explanation: The contract states that the entire Agreement, including any confidentiality provisions, ends one year from the effective date, with no separate post-termination period during which confidentiality must still be maintained. The rule requires the confidentiality obligation to remain in force for a defined period—typically two to five years—after disclosure or after the Agreement ends. Because the contract provides no such post-termination confidentiality duration, it does not satisfy the rule.
rule: Specify the duration of confidentiality obligations, commonly two to five years from the date of disclosure or termination of the agreement.
exampleLanguage: The confidentiality obligations set forth in this Agreement shall remain in effect for a period of [three (3)] years following the date of disclosure of any Confidential Information, or for a period of [three (3)] years following the termination of this Agreement, whichever is later.
